body_html:
You should look at the first error. It clearly says division by zero.
…
On Mar 6, 2018, at 02:07, z咸鱼 ***@***.***> wrote: I meet the same problem using the newest pytorch: Traceback (most recent call last): File "train_cls.py", line 70, in for ib, (data, lbl) in enumerate(train_loader): File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 259, in next return self._process_next_batch(batch) File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 293, in _process_next_batch raise batch.exc_type(batch.exc_msg) ZeroDivisionError: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 56, in _worker_loop samples = collate_fn([dataset[i] for i in batch_indices]) File "build/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/torchvision/datasets/folder.py", line 122, in getitem img = self.loader(path) File "build/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/torchvision/datasets/folder.py", line 69, in default_loader return pil_loader(path) File "build/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/torchvision/datasets/folder.py", line 51, in pil_loader img = Image.open(f) File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/PIL/Image.py", line 2506, in open im = _open_core(fp, filename, prefix) File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/PIL/Image.py", line 2496, in _open_core im = factory(fp, filename) File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/PIL/JpegImagePlugin.py", line 757, in jpeg_factory im = JpegImageFile(fp, filename) File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/PIL/ImageFile.py", line 100, in init self._open() File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/PIL/JpegImagePlugin.py", line 335, in _open handler(self, i) File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/PIL/JpegImagePlugin.py", line 127, in APP dpi = x_resolution[0] / x_resolution[1] ZeroDivisionError: integer division or modulo by zero Error in atexit._run_exitfuncs: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/atexit.py", line 24, in _run_exitfuncs func(*targs, **kargs) File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/util.py", line 328, in _exit_function p.join() File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/process.py", line 148, in join res = self._popen.wait(timeout) File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/forking.py", line 154, in wait return self.poll(0) File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/forking.py", line 135, in poll pid, sts = os.waitpid(self.pid, flag) File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 172, in handler _error_if_any_worker_fails() RuntimeError: DataLoader worker (pid 37825) is killed by signal: Terminated. Error in sys.exitfunc: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/atexit.py", line 24, in _run_exitfuncs func(*targs, **kargs) File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/util.py", line 328, in _exit_function p.join() File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/process.py", line 148, in join res = self._popen.wait(timeout) File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/forking.py", line 154, in wait return self.poll(0) File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/forking.py", line 135, in poll pid, sts = os.waitpid(self.pid, flag) File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 172, in handler _error_if_any_worker_fails() RuntimeError: DataLoader worker (pid 37825) is killed by signal: Terminated. — You are receiving this because you commented. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
body_text:
You should look at the first error. It clearly says division by zero.
…
 On Mar 6, 2018, at 02:07, z咸鱼 ***@***.***> wrote:

 I meet the same problem using the newest pytorch:

 Traceback (most recent call last):
 File "train_cls.py", line 70, in
 for ib, (data, lbl) in enumerate(train_loader):
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 259, in next
 return self._process_next_batch(batch)
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 293, in _process_next_batch
 raise batch.exc_type(batch.exc_msg)
 ZeroDivisionError: Traceback (most recent call last):
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 56, in _worker_loop
 samples = collate_fn([dataset[i] for i in batch_indices])
 File "build/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/torchvision/datasets/folder.py", line 122, in getitem
 img = self.loader(path)
 File "build/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/torchvision/datasets/folder.py", line 69, in default_loader
 return pil_loader(path)
 File "build/bdist.linux-x86_64/egg/torchvision/datasets/folder.py", line 51, in pil_loader
 img = Image.open(f)
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/PIL/Image.py", line 2506, in open
 im = _open_core(fp, filename, prefix)
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/PIL/Image.py", line 2496, in _open_core
 im = factory(fp, filename)
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/PIL/JpegImagePlugin.py", line 757, in jpeg_factory
 im = JpegImageFile(fp, filename)
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/PIL/ImageFile.py", line 100, in init
 self._open()
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/PIL/JpegImagePlugin.py", line 335, in _open
 handler(self, i)
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/PIL/JpegImagePlugin.py", line 127, in APP
 dpi = x_resolution[0] / x_resolution[1]
 ZeroDivisionError: integer division or modulo by zero

 Error in atexit._run_exitfuncs:
 Traceback (most recent call last):
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/atexit.py", line 24, in _run_exitfuncs
 func(*targs, **kargs)
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/util.py", line 328, in _exit_function
 p.join()
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/process.py", line 148, in join
 res = self._popen.wait(timeout)
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/forking.py", line 154, in wait
 return self.poll(0)
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/forking.py", line 135, in poll
 pid, sts = os.waitpid(self.pid, flag)
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 172, in handler
 _error_if_any_worker_fails()
 RuntimeError: DataLoader worker (pid 37825) is killed by signal: Terminated.
 Error in sys.exitfunc:
 Traceback (most recent call last):
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/atexit.py", line 24, in _run_exitfuncs
 func(*targs, **kargs)
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/util.py", line 328, in _exit_function
 p.join()
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/process.py", line 148, in join
 res = self._popen.wait(timeout)
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/forking.py", line 154, in wait
 return self.poll(0)
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/multiprocessing/forking.py", line 135, in poll
 pid, sts = os.waitpid(self.pid, flag)
 File "/home/crow/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/utils/data/dataloader.py", line 172, in handler
 _error_if_any_worker_fails()
 RuntimeError: DataLoader worker (pid 37825) is killed by signal: Terminated.

 —
 You are receiving this because you commented.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
body:
You should look at the first error. It clearly says division by zero. 

> On Mar 6, 2018, at 02:07, z咸鱼 <notifications@github.com> wrote:
